part1.converted_description:
You are given a rectangular screen that has a width of 50 pixels and a height of 6 pixels. The screen starts with all pixels turned off. The screen can be modified using three operations: "rect AxB" turns on all pixels in a rectangle at the top-left of the screen with width A and height B, "rotate row y=A by B" shifts all pixels in row A to the right by B positions, and "rotate column x=A by B" shifts all pixels in column A down by B positions. After applying a series of instructions to the screen, you need to determine how many pixels are turned on.

Input Format:
The input consists of a series of instructions for modifying the screen.

part2.converted_description:
After applying the series of instructions to the screen, you need to determine the code that the screen is trying to display. Each character in the code is represented by a 5x6 block of pixels on the screen. Extract the code block.

Input Format:
The input consists of a series of instructions for modifying the screen.

input:
rect 1x1
rotate row y=0 by 5
rect 1x1
rotate row y=0 by 6
